data.title: EarClippingTriangulator fails with axis aligned points.
data.body:
There is an error where ear clipping gives obviously wrong results.
Note that there is no degenerate geometry here (zero length edges for eg).

To redo the bug, this testcase can be added.
tests/gdx-tests/src/com/badlogic/gdx/tests/EarClippingTriangulatorTest.java

```
testCases.add(new TestCase(new float[] {0.5399998426437378, 0.4341592788696289, -0.5400000214576721, 0.4341592788696289, -0.5400000214576721, 0.46285152435302734, -0.554999828338623, 0.46285152435302734, -0.554999828338623, -0.9009346961975098, -0.5400000214576721, -0.9009346961975098, -0.5400000214576721, 0.33415889739990234, 0.5399998426437378, -0.8859329223632812, 0.5550003051757812, -0.9159364700317383}));
```

It produces this:
![gdx_fill_bug](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1869379/1809218/b2f4d44e-6dbf-11e3-9a29-f72d945c2784.png)

But should look like this:

![gdx_fill_working](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1869379/1809222/3fa1e008-6dc0-11e3-80b2-77eb84bc562f.png)

data.title: MipMapTest: added ui.act in render method
data.body: It was not possible to change the filter due to the missing call to ui.act.

data.title: Refactored demo to use the rectangle class to demonstrate overlapping
data.body: Refactored demo to use the rectangle class to demonstrate overlapping rather than creating an extra OverlapTester class that just makes it a bit more confusing for new users.

data.title: Move Box2d to an extension
data.body:
Long ago, [in a galaxy far away](http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=8268), @badlogic brought up the idea of moving Box2D out of the libgdx core. This pull request removes Box2D to an extension so people who want/need it can add it.

Notes:
- I attempted to create the necessary maven information, but since I am not incredibly familiar with how this works, I may not have done it properly. Someone should check it.
- I made a library descriptor for the extension so it can be included in the Setup-UI, however it will show as a "Third Party" Library due to the Setup-UI not having an "Extensions" section. Is this acceptable, or do we want to try to modify the Setup-UI to have an "Extensions" section (and include box2d, bullet, and freetype as options).
- I moved the ParticleEmitterBox2D into the physics package, to ease the GWT side of things.
- I was only able to test on Windows 64-bit, Android and GWT

Obviously, we'd need to make sure the change was well-known. Thoughts?

data.title: no lwjgl in java.library.path
data.body:
Howdy,

i think its a little "Bug".
Im using eclipse, i had adding all used JAR's from libGDX but i get a UnsatisfiedLink Exception.

How i can set **_java.library.path**_ if the last libGDX Downloads dont have a natives-Directory? All natives are on the JAR Packages...

data.body: Effects that are not rendered on a black background can be designed better with this change

data.body:
- fixed getResultAsString to copy the whole http respnse into the string
- added a second button to NetAPITest to download a text file

data.title: Hard-coded judgement of TextureRegionDrawable
Box2d and OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer render issues.
data.body:
I have a player, represented by a box2d body that is able to push around other bod2d bodies around a map rendered by a OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer. Frequently, something will glitch out and I will get "lines" of the next "tile" in the tileset. Here is an example:
![example](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3410271/1797423/3f1ac058-6ad9-11e3-9a3d-7c279b1f528c.png)

data.title: Remove deprecated wakelock from AndroidDaydream
data.body: We don't use this type of wakelock anymore.

data.title: Allow ImageTextButton to have image and label on separate rows
data.body:
`ImageTextButton` allows you to create button where the image and label are on the same row (image left, label right).

Added functionality to allow the image and label to be on separate rows (image top, label below)

data.title: [android] add AndroidApplicationConfiguration.useAudio option
data.body: The AndroidAudio class is referenced directly in a few other places, so this was the most self-contained way to implement the useAudio option.

data.title: TextField#getSelection fix
data.body: I'm totally forgot that selectionStart can be < cursor ( causes a StringIndexOutOfBoundsException ).

data.title: Issue with glGetUniformLocation on different graphic drivers(?!)
data.body:
This is not a bug on your side, I think it's more an issue of the implementation of the opengl driver.

On some graphic cards you can use

```
program.getUniformLocation("u_lightPosition");
```

to get the uniform location of an array

```
// this tries to get
uniform vec3 u_lightPosition[10];
```

and on others you have to use

```
program.getUniformLocation("u_lightPosition[0]");
```

instead.

On my nvidia card @ home I can use the last one. On my Nexus 4 too. At work I have to use the other one, otherwise, glGetUniformLocation returns -1

This btw. should be the reason why the pointlights in your default shader do not work. (for everyone)

Till now I did not find any solution for that. Did you?

Leslie

data.title: Can't extend ParticleEmitter
data.body: Hi, can we please make the private variable of ParticleEmitter.java changed to 'protected'? Also, at least the update function to protected instead of private. That way I can extend ParticleEmitter to create my own one which allows the particles to track a target each frame.

data.title: Add controller listeners clear method
data.body: I find this useful to clear all listeners in a once

data.title: Minor changes in UI widgets
data.body: As I have been using libGDX for over 2 years by now, [I] decided to make some contributions to common code base. Please find first minor changes to HorizontalGroup and VerticalGroup (to partially support zero-width widgets), and an addition to Actor class as this is something I repeatedly ran into and had to implement locally while developing gdx-based games.

data.title: Use Json to save and load particle effects
data.body:
Note that the ParticleEmitter (BufferedReader reader) constructor is removed as the emitters are created by Json (in the ParticleEffect class).
As a result the ParticleEmitterBox2D (World world, BufferedReader reader) constructor is removed as well.

I tested this change using the particle editor and all seems to be working properly.

Do we need some kind of file converter to update the old particle files into the Json files?

data.title: Add default button that set the particle sprite to 'particle.png'
data.body: This patch adds a 'default' button to the editor which will set the particle sprite back to the default 'particle.png'

data.title: BitmapFont.Glyph, java.lang.NoSuchFieldError: id
data.body:
When I try to load a font with "font = font_generator.generateFont(16);" causes the exception "java.lang.NoSuchFieldError: id".

Looking at the source code I see that the field 'id' is declared, however the compiled libs causes the exception.

The libgdx version used is 0.9.9

data.title: Merge pull request #1 from libgdx/master
data.body: Update

data.title: Fix for rare ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in AndroidMultiTouchHandler
data.body: It is unfortunately back. :( This should fix #1095 and #945  It will at least prevent crashes in those weird situations. I can't test on a HTC One, but maybe the reported can.

data.title: TexturePacker does not start
data.body:
I cannot start the TexturePacker as explained in the manual.
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Texture-packer

`java -cp gdx.jar:extensions/gdx-tools/gdx-tools.jar com.badlogic.gdx.tools.imagepacker.TexturePacker2
Error: Could not find or load main class com.badlogic.gdx.tools.imagepacker.TexturePacker2`
